item.title: Mary add a quote by Norman Maclean
item.description: "I, an old man, have written this fire report. Among other things, it was important to me, as an exercise for old age, to enlarge my knowledge and spirit so I could accompany young men whose lives I might have lived on their way to death. I have climbed where they climbed, and in my time I have fought fire and inquired into its nature. In addition, I have lived to get a better understanding of myself and those close to me, many of them now dead. Perhaps it is not odd, at the end of this tragedy, where nothing much was left of the elite who came from the sky, but courage struggling for oxygen, that I have often found myself thinking of my wife on her brave and lonely way to death." -- Norman Maclean

item.title: Mary add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mary add a quote by Hari Kunzru
item.description: "There was, as she put it, nothing to stop me. So I followed the path of educated misfits through the ages and got a job in a bookshop." -- Hari Kunzru

item.title: Mary add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "The world spins. We stumble on. It is enough." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Mary add a quote by Kevin Brockmeier
item.description: "...When you die, the energy that kept you alive filters into the people you loved. Did you know that? It's like a fire you've tended all your life, and the sparks are all scattered into the wind.... That's why we survive as long as we do, because the people who loved us keep us going." -- Kevin Brockmeier

item.title: Mary add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "We all had to say goodbye, sooner or later, to those we love--or they had to say goodbye to us. Those were the only two possibilities that this world allowed. But no matter how much we tried to face up to it, it never became easier." -- Alexander McCall Smith
